title: IDOR: leak buyer info & Publish/Hide foreign comments

profile.name: Judge.me
profile.about: Judge.me powers the product reviews for e-commerce stores. Our apps help you collect and display reviews on Shopify, WooCommerce and BigCommerce.

vulnerability_information:
HI @judgeme!
I noticed that the attacker can learn email users who left feedback at the time of buying.

Step to reproduce:

1. Login to our store and install your 'Checkout Comments' addon
2. Make fake order in or store and write a comment

███

3. Then go to our Shopify `/admin/apps/checkout-comments/extensions/checkout_comments/comments`
4. Publish our comment and Intercept request with burp. Send request to Repeater. Request example:

POST /extensions/checkout_comments/curate_comment HTTP/1.1
Host: judge.me
Cookie: _judgeme_session=████████████████; _ga=GA1.2.1935027813.1637882690; _gid=GA1.2.2043288340.1637882690; _fbp=fb.1.1637882690590.2069272048; _gat_UA-28424713-2=1
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/99.0.7113.93 Safari/537.36
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://judge.me/extensions/checkout_comments/comments?platform=shopify&shop_domain=test-hackerone-glis.myshopify.com&page=3&offset=50
X-Csrf-Token: ████==
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Content-Length: 23
Origin: https://judge.me
Te: trailers
Connection: close

comment_id=1&curated=ok



5. Edit `comment_id=random_id` and in Response we can see buyer information (for example):


`{"comment":{"id":1,"content":"classic dress watch for weddings","created_at":"over 3 years ago","product":{"title":"Dress Watch","url":"https://████.myshopify.com/products/dress-watch"},"buyer":{"name":"F F","email":"██████████@gmail.com"},"published_status":true,"published_status_text":"Published","curated":"ok"}}`


██████



Video POC:



██████

## Impact

Buyer information leaks and other

additional_data.new_title: a leak of buyer email & Publish/Hide foreign comments

activities.message:
UPDATE:

If we change :

curated=ok  - We publish any comment
curated=spam - We hide any comment

Thnx)

UPDATE POC


█████

Hi @sodacan!
The fact is that this method reveals the email users of other online store to which I do not have access.


`"url":"https://█████████.myshopify.com/products/dress-watch"` This line in response to the request shows which site the user belongs to the user. That is, on which site he left a review. Having played with the parameter  `comment_id=` we can see user comments from other sites, their email, name. As well as Public or Hide сomments that do not belong to our site. Play with the parameter `comment_id=` and pay attention to the string `"url":"https://█████████.myshopify.com/products/dress-watch"` that the domain will change, that is, we will have access to reviews not prenate us. In the example it is clear that in response  `"url":"https://██████.myshopify.com/products/dress-watch"`  and my test account url = https://test-hackerone-glis.myshopify.com/


P.S. That is, I have privileges to moderate and watch information about other people's reviews and their owners

In the first video, pay attention to the address bar in the browser is mine in which I am the administrator. and pay attention to the answer to the request which domain is indicated. Play with `comment_id=` in response we can see random domain with comment owner info.
Thnx

For verification you can go to my test domain product: [TestDomain](https://test-hackerone-glis.myshopify.com/products/test-product ) I left a review there - but he is in status "Hide". It is not published on the site.  It  `comment_id=████`
Log in to you store and catch request. paste in  `comment_id=████1&curated=ok` and you See a content, customer email and other info that does not belong to your account in response!

If we send  `comment_id=██████████1&curated=ok` then go to my product page [TestDomain](https://test-hackerone-glis.myshopify.com/products/test-product ) - you can see that comment is published.

If we send  `comment_id=█████1&curated=spam` then go to my product page [TestDomain](https://test-hackerone-glis.myshopify.com/products/test-product ) - you can see that comment is hide.

Thnx
Sorry... my`comment_id=███`

The essence of the vulnerability is that I do not have access to the Judge account for example for the site example.com I can collect all mail the name and surname of the text of the question and other user data with Checkout Question. And also publish / hide the use of comments on the site that I am not prenate. I do actions for someone else's accounts on your own behalf. For this, I do not need a Judge.me account for Example.com. And it is enough to register an account for the site that I am prenate (for example, Mysite.com) and then I have privileges that would learn / publish / hide data from someone else's Judge.me Account.

Best wishes @glister !

P.S. `comment_id=████` i hide so that you tested
Hi team! Any updates?

Store password `Triumf123` (because my store in dev mode) for test `comment_id=████████` Hide/Publish comment. 

Can you сheck report? thnx
I am sorry, but 5 days - STATE = NEW

Hi @sodacan  & @judgeme!

I would like to clarify this vulnerability. On the video we can see what I intercepted the request (when i publish comment in Checkout Comments admin panel ) with `comment_id=193665`  as in response to the request in the field `"url":"https://test-hackerone-glis.myshopify.com/products/test24"` -  This means that I have published a comment and received the buyer's data in your domain that is prenated me. But if we change `comment_id=` random  but  `comment_id` < 193665  we can publish/hide customer comments of another shops and See their data as (email,name,what product they bought)

P.S. what access we get to someone's data we can see when `comment_id=`  then `"url":`   It indicates which domain belongs to the data and to which product they are published
Hi! Any updates?

Hi @glister,

Sorry for the late reply and thanks for the report! We are able to reproduce it. We will work on a fix for this.

thnx)
Why is it high and not critical?) There is also violations of rights and information about the user

@glister Because there is a lost of confidentiality, but not a total lost. For integrity, there is a pretty small loss (publishing status), but there isn't a score for "pretty small", so we "round up" to "Low".
We have fixed the issue, can you please help retest this?
